**Potential Thesis for a Master in Design**

As companies like Google, Dell, and other tech giants invest 
in bringing new technologies to developing countries,  what is 
the current approach to designing solutions for populations 
with cultures different from those displayed in North America.

Inspirations:
* Article from The Guardian (June 2013): "[Technology can empower children in developing countries - if it's done right](http://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/technology-empower-children-developing-countries)"
* Venture from Engineers Without Borders Canada (2015): "[Numida Technologies](https://www.ewb.ca/ventures/numida-technologies)"

**Playbook, a personal planner**

Facing an overwhelming amount of ideas for new projects, 
I wanted to design a solution to help me organize those 
ideas into projects, objectives, and tasks.

New Inspirations:
* Google Calendar Goals Feature (April 2016): "[Find time for your goals with Google Calendar](https://googleblog.blogspot.ca/2016/04/find-time-goals-google-calendar.html)"
* Trello (January 2011): "[Trello Tour](https://trello.com/tour)"

**World University Expo, welcoming foreign students in Canada**

Winning the second place at Startup Weekend Sherbrooke 2014, 
this project had good potential to make a difference in the 
way foreign students choose the university they will attend.
However, designing a rapid prototype proved to be a challenge 
for a rapidly-evolving project.
